storylines.description: This is destined to be an unrestful night
storylines.title: Prince of Jin of Xuan

storylines.description: Xie Ruolan gives you a precious jade comb
storylines.title: The Costly Jade

storylines.description: Xie Jian'an and Chu Huan differ in their approaches to handling Yu Gong's anti-imperial poem incident
storylines.title: Two Possible Methods

storylines.description: The Emperor is very disappointed with your handling of matters and decides to send you out of the capital
storylines.title: The Emperor's Will is Unfathomable

storylines.description: Should you grease the wheels with a court attendant close to the Emperor to gather intelligence?
storylines.title: The Emperor's Close Attendant

storylines.description: Do you know why I summoned you here?
storylines.title: The Emperor's Summons

storylines.description: What is your relationship with the traitor Yu Gong?
storylines.title: Relationship with Yu Gong

storylines.description: Were you present when Yu Gong wrote the anti-imperial poem?
storylines.title: Whether Present or Not

storylines.description: Since you were present, why did you not punish the traitor who wrote the anti-imperial poem?
storylines.title: Reason for Sparing Yu Gong

storylines.description: Should you grease the wheels with a court attendant close to the Emperor to gather intelligence?
storylines.title: The Emperor's Inner Servant

storylines.description: At this late hour, what brings you hastily into the palace?
storylines.title: Entering the Palace Late at Night

storylines.description: How can you diffuse the Emperor's anger so you can spare Yu Gong?
storylines.title: Method of Pleading for Mercy

storylines.description: How do you think I should treat a traitor like Yu Gong who disrespects the Son of Heaven?
storylines.title: Dealing with the Treacherous Official

storylines.description: How can you go further and truly move the Emperor?
storylines.title: The Emperor's Thoughts

storylines.description: You are one move away from beating the Emperor; do you want to win this game?
storylines.title: The Emperor's Chess Game

storylines.description: The Emperor asks your opinion about your elder brother Prince Ning's poor performance in Qingzhou
storylines.title: The Erring Elder Brother

storylines.description: Chen Wan'er claims the truth has been uncovered, but actually the gentry want to sacrifice a pawn to cover Prince Ning's faults
storylines.title: The Scapegoat

storylines.description: At the brink of life and death, Guo Xuan was probably panicked and mistakenly sought help from your political enemy, Prince Ning
storylines.title: The Pleading Chess Piece

storylines.description: Your elder brother Prince Ning asks if your consolidation of influence means you intend to contend with him
storylines.title: Prince of Ning's Warning

storylines.description: You stop and watch your brother's retreating back as he strides away alone
storylines.title: Walking the Path Alone

storylines.description: The court is a battlefield without swords
storylines.title: Deliberations in the Imperial Court

storylines.description: Sikong Zheng is proposing to take a Chen family woman as a consort in court
storylines.title: The Marriage Alliance of the Prince of Ning

storylines.description: You and Prince Ning visit the Empress; only one pastry remains
storylines.title: The Empress's Pastries

storylines.description: To foil the marriage between Prince Ning and the Chen family, Xie Jian'an suggests you meet Chen Wan'er
storylines.title: Chen Wan'er's Thoughts

storylines.description: To seek cooperation with you, Chen Wan'er confesses the difficulties of her position in the Chen household
storylines.title: The Eldest Daughter of the Chen Family

storylines.description: According to Chen Wan'er, Chu Huan found the warehouse where the Chen family hoarded misappropriated supplies; it's up to you to decide whether to deploy troops
storylines.title: Embezzled Supplies

storylines.description: The warehouse is full of arms; you realize you've been set up and an elite force arrives, surrounding you
storylines.title: The Suddenly Arrived Army

storylines.description: On Prince Ning's wedding night, an unforgivable mistake occurred; if only there were a potion of regret
storylines.title: Let the Mistake Stand

storylines.description: Chen Wan'er's instigation is utterly untrustworthy! You rush to the palace to explain things to the Emperor; better late than never
storylines.title: A Sudden Misfortune

storylines.description: Forced to act, you lead your loyalists into armed revolt and break into the palace
storylines.title: Chaos in the Imperial Palace

storylines.description: Heaven favored you and you succeeded; thereafter you govern earnestly and lead Da Xuan to hegemonic glory
storylines.title: The Chosen One

storylines.description: You were imprisoned due to the Chen family's plot, and your judge is Prince Ning Sikong Zheng
storylines.title: Thrown Into Prison

storylines.description: In prison, Sikong Zheng distorts the facts and frames you as treasonous
storylines.title: Sikong Zheng's False Accusation

storylines.description: Sikong Zheng urges you to pin everything on Chu Huan to exonerate yourself
storylines.title: A Chance to Escape Blame

storylines.description: For you and for Lady Xie Ruolan, let Chu Huan take the blame and stop the fighting. This is Prince Ning's last favor to you
storylines.title: The Final Ultimatum

storylines.description: After years of hiding, you have rebuilt much strength, but the situation is chaotic and the front is dire; should you advance or retreat?
storylines.title: The Tumultuous Times

storylines.description: From then on, live incognito and be a reclusive couple — why not?
storylines.title: Attaining Enlightenment and Immortality

storylines.description: Since you bear Sikong blood, you cannot ignore Da Xuan and the people; defend the homeland and do not shirk your duty
storylines.title: My Surname is Sikong

storylines.description: Xie Ruolan senses your peril and finds a way to resolve the problem
storylines.title: The Princess Consort of the Prince of Jin

storylines.description: No choice; after all, our father only had two sons
storylines.title: Dwindling Imperial Heirs

storylines.description: When you were in trouble, who did Xie Ruolan seek help from that became the path to breaking the stalemate?
storylines.title: A Path to Break the Deadlock

storylines.description: The Empress is willing to plead with the Emperor on your behalf — this is your chance to allay the Emperor's suspicions
storylines.title: This Subject Has Something to Say

storylines.description: The Emperor questions why you did not report the Chen family's misdeeds and instead ordered troops privately
storylines.title: The Reason for Deploying Troops

storylines.description: You suggest that the Chen family took bribes and that I had a share?
storylines.title: Am I, the Emperor, Greedy?

storylines.description: The Emperor's attitude softens; he no longer suspects your treason so long as you reveal who gave the troop order to end the matter
storylines.title: The One Who Deployed the Troops

storylines.description: At least in the Emperor's eyes, your decisiveness does not match your elder brother's — go and be a comfortable prince
storylines.title: Decipher the Emperor's Intentions

storylines.description: A toast to meeting, a toast to parting forever, a toast to the burden you have taken up. I cannot be the mountain-splitting blade, but I can be the brick under your foot
storylines.title: Parting From an Old Friend

storylines.description: In the end, you could not wait for a turn of fate
storylines.help:
[Prologue] The scapegoat → Expose her intentions
[Prologue] The pawn seeking rescue → Save Guo Xuan
[Chapter 1] The path to break the stalemate → The Empress
storylines.title: The Butterfly Effect

storylines.description: You broke into the palace, but your forces could not overcome the city guard; the effort failed at the last moment — cursed by fate
storylines.title: Such is Fate

storylines.description: In this chaotic era there are the extravagant and the patriotic, the schemers and the petty — may Your Highness not forget your original purpose through the hardships ahead
storylines.title: North and South of the River

storylines.description: The power of the gentry and the will of the Son of Heaven cannot be overturned by right and wrong; now you should go bid Chu Huan farewell
storylines.title: The Final Outcome

storylines.description: When will these stormy waves cease? Perhaps when someone becomes the loser
storylines.title: The Wind Does Not Cease

storylines.description: Xie Ruolan's younger brother returns to the capital; you and his sister gather at the Prince of Jin's mansion
storylines.title: A Rare Family Banquet

storylines.description: Xie Xuan and Chu Huan's entrusted man clashes with someone — do you use this chance to test his mettle?
storylines.title: True Measure of One's Capabilities

storylines.description: Speaking of what gift to give Zu Kun, the jade comb Xie gave is rather good
storylines.title: Where Is the Jade Thumb Ring

storylines.description: Zu Kun returns to the capital and invites you to a banquet; how can you leave a good impression?
storylines.title: The Subtleties of Attending a Banquet

storylines.description: Compared with Sikong Zheng's mountain-like gift, the stirrups you brought seem a bit shabby
storylines.title: A Humble Gift

storylines.description: Compared with Sikong Zheng's mountain-like gift, you arrived empty-handed with only the breeze in your sleeves
storylines.title: Empty-handed

storylines.description: This rare Kunshan jade finally has a purpose — rely on it to win over Zu Kun
storylines.title: An Object of Great Value

storylines.description: The scholar who presented a poem to Zu Kun looks vaguely familiar, doesn't he?
storylines.title: A Scholar's Fervor

storylines.description: At Zu Kun's banquet, Zu Yue wants to spar with you
storylines.title: Zu Yue's Challenge

storylines.description: You step into the courtyard and the duel with Zu Yue begins
storylines.title: The Clash of Blades

storylines.description: Due to your poor skill, you repeatedly miss in the duel and Zu Yue is accidentally killed
storylines.title: Swords and Spears Have No Eyes

storylines.description: Zhu Yuanzhi outmatched Zu Yue in the bout; unexpectedly, Chu Huan left this talent for you
storylines.title: Talented Allies by One's Side

storylines.description: At the banquet, Zu Kun brings up the northern campaign — this is your best opportunity to draw closer to him
storylines.title: The Debate on the Northern Expedition

storylines.description: There are countless difficulties with a northern campaign, but right now your task is not to solve those military problems but to resolve the Emperor's view on it
storylines.title: The Crux of the Northern Campaign

storylines.description: If the northern campaign fails, who dares shoulder the blame for squandering state power? Who can bear it?
storylines.title: Responsibility for the Defeat

storylines.description: The Emperor seems unwilling to send troops north; if Zu Kun has no objection, this matter is probably decided
storylines.title: Zu Kun's Opinion

storylines.description: Because you failed to seize the chance at the banquet to leverage Zu Kun's influence for the northern campaign, Sikong Zheng suppressed you until you could not raise your head; you had to march north, were ambushed by Wu Pu and died
storylines.title: The Lone Brave

storylines.description: After the banquet, Chen Wan'er brings you a bowl of sobering soup
storylines.title: Sobering Soup

storylines.description: You wish to travel far — when will you return?
storylines.title: Asking About Your Return

storylines.description: Leaving the capital to join the army and go north, the skies and seas are vast and Prince Ning cannot restrain you
storylines.title: A Dragon Returns to the Sea

storylines.description: Why would a man not take the Wu hook and reclaim fifty border prefectures?
storylines.title: Northern Expedition

storylines.description: On the army's march north you meet an unidentified youth
storylines.title: The Youth in the Woods

storylines.description: The northern refugees greet the royal army joyfully, bringing the scarce grain they could spare
storylines.title: The Kindness of the Former People

storylines.description: A great battle is about to begin; ask around about Yiyang's current situation
storylines.title: The Situation in Yiyang

storylines.description: Former minister Chu Maolun of Xuan arrives beneath Yiyang's walls and seems to want to speak with you
storylines.title: Former Officials of Xuan

storylines.description: Former minister Chu Maolun of Xuan wishes to enter the city to speak with you privately
storylines.title: Request to Enter the City

storylines.description: A mere dog by Wu Pu's horse dares to request parley?
storylines.title: Execute the Traitor with an Arrow

storylines.description: Chu Maolun says the lost national jade seal is held by Shi Lang and hopes to trade it with you for mutual benefit
storylines.title: The Imperial Heirloom Seal

storylines.description: What do you intend to do about Chu Maolun's proposed deal?
storylines.title: Northward Advance, Southern Return

storylines.description: The imperial jade seal is tempting; you accept Chu Maolun's words and fall into a Wu Nu trap
storylines.title: Imperial Seal of a Fallen Dynasty

storylines.description: Shi Lang forces the captured Xuan refugees to assault the walls
storylines.title: Refugees Assaulting the City

storylines.description: The refugees steadily approach — under no circumstances may they place ladders against the battlements
storylines.title: The Wall in Crisis

storylines.description: Never shoot arrows at Xuan's people! Ride out and fight to the death!
storylines.title: He's a Real Man

storylines.description: To lift morale, you decide to avoid Wu Pu's main force and launch a night raid on their camp
storylines.title: The Main Force of the Wuyou

storylines.description: This is a near-suicide mission — who will lead the night raid on Wu Pu's camp?
storylines.title: Plan for the Night Raid

storylines.description: You order Xie Xuan to raid the camp; although the raid initially succeeds, his fondness for battle keeps him from breaking off and the enemy pursues, resulting in the city's fall
storylines.title: Poor Judgment in Appointments

storylines.description: When Yiyang is in peril, a ragtag relief army suddenly arrives — can this improvised militia really be relied upon?
storylines.title: Unexpected Reinforcements

storylines.description: The militia enters the city, but a Wu Nu traitor is among them; he deliberately creates chaos and colludes with the Wu Nu army, leading to the city's fall
storylines.title: Sabotage by Spies

storylines.description: To protect the city, you decide not to admit the militia for now; this will chill their hearts and you must quickly find a way to appease them
storylines.title: Pacify the Righteous Fighters

storylines.description: Sending people out to placate the militia is useful, but a Wu Nu spy learns the Prince of Jin is outside the walls; when the Wu Nu army attacks, you have nowhere to flee
storylines.title: Carelessness Leads to Death

storylines.description: You sneak into the militia camp to meet the leader Liu Dadao privately, but you are discovered
storylines.title: Exposed Whereabouts

storylines.description: To intimidate Liu Dadao you must provide reasons why the militia is unreliable
storylines.title: Suspicion Towards the Righteous Army

storylines.description: To convince Liu Dadao, you must present a reasonable method for rooting out spies and accepting the militia
storylines.title: Recruitment of the Righteous Army

storylines.description: Following the flute's tune, you climb the walls and find the militia leader's granddaughter Liu Nian playing a melody alone
storylines.title: The Melody on the City Walls

storylines.description: Are the Wu Pu people truly that powerful and unbeatable?
storylines.title: A Formidable Enemy

storylines.description: Xuan's true enemy has never been to the north
storylines.title: Gaze Northward

storylines.description: Misjudging the enemy's main force, the assault fails and you are captured by Wu Nu
storylines.title: Emperor Wu of Xuan

storylines.description: Wu Pu has besieged the city for days and no relief has arrived
storylines.title: Trapped in Yiyang

storylines.description: Shi Lang's army suddenly broke camp and withdrew — perhaps our reinforcements arrived
storylines.title: The Truth About the Reinforcements

storylines.description: Shi Lang feigns retreat to lure Yiyang's garrison out, and you fall into the trap
storylines.title: Sudden Turnaround Thrust

storylines.description: Shi Lang launches a general assault and Yiyang is attacked from multiple sides
storylines.title: Struggling to Cope

storylines.description: Shi Lang attacks from two sides; you decide to send troops to relieve the east. After fires in the south you retreat and Sikong Zheng ascends the throne; you live bitterly as the Exiled Prince
storylines.title: The Carefree Prince

storylines.description: In the crisis, you decide to lead Xie Xuan to reinforce the southern city
storylines.title: Rushing Reinforcements to the Southern City

storylines.description: Shi Lang attacks from two sides; you lead the west relief force. After the southern fires you abandon the city and are caught and cut down by Shi Lang
storylines.title: Frequent Running Champion

storylines.description: Shi Lang attacks from two sides; you order everyone to reinforce the north and ultimately die fighting in the south after the fires
storylines.title: Fire in the Southern City

storylines.description: You launch an all-or-nothing raid on Shi Lang's camp but are killed due to lack of skill
storylines.title: Lack of Martial Prowess

storylines.description: For yourself, your brothers, and the thousands of soldiers who fight to the last, this is a life-or-death battle that cannot be lost
storylines.title: Storming into the Enemy Camp

storylines.description: Liu Dadao guarding the west fled
storylines.title: Better You than Me

storylines.description: Seven days of defense, arrows exhausted, heavy casualties — Yiyang's fall is imminent
storylines.title: A Losing Battle

storylines.description: In Yiyang's dire straits, at Xie Xuan's urging you decide to burn the granaries and abandon the city
storylines.title: The Fault Lies with Your Subject

storylines.description: Horsemen into the mountain of blades — return not until broken
storylines.title: Charge into the enemy camp

storylines.description: You storm the enemy camp; an arrow strikes Shi Lang but you are killed by Shi Lang
storylines.title: Slightly Outmatched in Skill

storylines.description: You launch an all-or-nothing raid on Shi Lang's camp but are killed due to lack of skill
storylines.title: Less Agile Physique

storylines.description: You launch an all-or-nothing raid on Shi Lang's camp but are slain by Shi Lang
storylines.title: Flashy but Useless Moves

storylines.description: You launch an all-or-nothing raid on Shi Lang's camp but are killed due to lack of skill
storylines.title: Every Extra Inch Counts

storylines.description: Break the ranks, charge into the enemy, and wound Shi Lang severely — this man will be a future menace. Young one, give your name!
storylines.title: Who Is This Person

storylines.description: Shi Lang, learning you are the Prince of Jin of Xuan, rejoices greatly
storylines.title: So Close Yet So Far

storylines.description: Zu Yue leads troops to relieve Yiyang; Shi Lang is forced to withdraw, and in the southern capital Prince Jin's mansion Xie Ruolan gives birth
storylines.title: A Joyous Occasion at the Prince's Residence

storylines.description: You launch an all-or-nothing raid on Shi Lang's camp but are killed due to lack of skill
storylines.title: Backed the Wrong Patron

storylines.description: A broken blade does not mean defeat — you can still grab the broken sword. Pick up the broken blade!
storylines.title: Broken Blade

storylines.description: Yong'an grows distant, our resolve has reached its end
storylines.title: The General Departs

storylines.description: What are you fighting for? And why fight?
storylines.title: What Are We Fighting For

storylines.description: An urgent letter from the capital reaches Yiyang; your scouts sent to probe the capital return at last
storylines.title: Urgent Missive from the Imperial City

storylines.description: Zu Kun has just left; the army's affairs are chaotic and the capital sends word the Emperor is ill, summoning you home at once
storylines.title: Return to the Capital at Once

storylines.description: You answered the imperial edict to return and see the ailing Emperor — and never returned
storylines.title: Brotherly Respect and Harmony

storylines.description: You suspect this edict is not so simple
storylines.title: The Meaning of the Imperial Decree

storylines.description: You think the Emperor summoned you to abdicate and was killed by Chen Ying upon your return
storylines.title: A Fleeting Dream

storylines.description: A former benefactor now an enemy — persuading Cao Biaozhi to surrender may benefit you both
storylines.title: Urging Surrender at the City Walls

storylines.description: Chen Ying arrives at the Yiyang camp with a ministerial order to take command of Yiyang's forces
storylines.title: The Ministry of War's Transfer Order

storylines.description: You refuse to hand over the tiger tally to Chen Ying; Sikong Zheng grows wary and immediately acts
storylines.title: Alerting the Enemy by Rash Action

storylines.description: Xie Jian'an rushed to Yiyang from afar — this night will not be peaceful
storylines.title: Defying One's Superior

storylines.description: You refused Zhu Yuanzhi's counsel and were overtaken by Sikong Zheng's preemptive strike
storylines.title: Hesitation Leads to Defeat

storylines.description: One step back cannot mean retreat step by step — today we march south with a clear conscience
storylines.title: Divine Mandate Is with Me

storylines.description: After tonight, Xuan will never be peaceful again; those who know your pain wish to keep you company for the moment
storylines.title: The Great Battle Approaches

storylines.description: A thoughtful maiden makes you a calming incense to grant you, at least until dawn, a peaceful dream
storylines.title: Calming Incense

storylines.description: With the passes ahead and pursuers behind, time is tight; a Wu Pu man claims he can resolve the crisis
storylines.title: Pressing Time

storylines.description: Even in crisis you do not wish to trade with the Wu Nu
storylines.title: Refusing to Cooperate

storylines.description: An old enemy met unexpectedly today looks so fallen from grace
storylines.title: Meeting Shi Lang Again

storylines.description: Shi Lang asks you for military supplies and promises to hold back the Qingzhou army
storylines.title: A Business Deal

storylines.description: You generously supply Shi Lang but he betrays his promise
storylines.title: Money Is No Object

storylines.description: It is both business and gamble — high demands, settle on the ground
storylines.title: Haggling Over Terms

storylines.description: Underbidding too hard leads to an irreparable split
storylines.title: Negotiations Broke Down

storylines.description: In the southern rebellion's siege battle, Cao Biaozhi's arrow decides the outcome
storylines.title: Decisive Strike for Victory

storylines.description: Pursuers are at your heels; waste no time — by any means necessary, seize this Tangchi iron city
storylines.title: Breaching the City

storylines.description: During the great battle someone is secretly colluding with the enemy seeking an escape; how to deal with them is your decision
storylines.title: Evidence of Colluding with the Enemy

storylines.description: Eunuch Wen suddenly arrives at the camp bearing the Emperor's edict
storylines.title: An Unexpected Emissary

storylines.description: After abandoning the southward march, you bring back the princess, march north and establish a new Jin princely court; the realm is divided into three, and who will claim supremacy remains unknown
storylines.title: The Turn of History's Wheel

storylines.description: Bold Wen Xian is guilty of forging an imperial edict — for such a crime he should be executed!
storylines.title: A Forged Imperial Decree

storylines.description: Many in the army decide to abandon the rebellion in face of rich rewards and high office
storylines.title: Divide and Conquer

storylines.description: Sikong Zheng persuades you to withdraw for now, promising to let Xie Ruolan leave the city
storylines.title: Advance or Retreat

storylines.description: Sikong Zheng demands you retreat further
storylines.title: A Dilemma

storylines.description: You decide to fall back thirty li for Xie Ruolan's sake, missing the chance and being overtaken by the Qingzhou army
storylines.title: Encircled and Trapped

storylines.description: Winners and losers determine fate; old hatreds and fresh grievances — Sikong Zheng's life or death now rests on your word
storylines.title: Victors and Losers

storylines.description: The fratricidal fighting with your brother finally ends here
storylines.title: Brothers

storylines.description: How to deal with Sikong Zheng is your decision
storylines.title: Disposition

storylines.description: The secret to lasting prosperity is not putting all your eggs in one basket
storylines.title: A Subtle Blade

storylines.description: The Chen family's centuries-old prestige — better mutual destruction than letting enemies take power
storylines.title: Emperor Min of Xuan

storylines.description: Set up an altar, proclaim to the world, succeed to the throne, and change the era name to Longwu!
storylines.title: The Mandate of Heaven

storylines.description: Since ascending the throne, ten or more swift years have passed; your ambitions have not diminished an inch
storylines.title: Gazing upon the Vast Sea

storylines.description: On how to deal with Wu Pu, your two sons each have their own views
storylines.title: Tactics and Strategy

storylines.description: The Crown Prince's horse ran wild and struck the imperial carriage
storylines.title: Startled Horse

storylines.description: State affairs weigh heavily; only with Lady Jing can you find some leisure
storylines.title: Consort Liu Jing

storylines.description: You planned to find peace with Lady Jing, but Chen Wan'er unexpectedly came to the palace
storylines.title: Lady Chen

storylines.description: The treasury is thin — where should this year's limited funds be spent?
storylines.title: Court Expenditures

storylines.description: It is late — where will you stay tonight?
storylines.title: Flipping the Plaques

storylines.description: This debauched, carnivorous revelry and absurd dream must now be awakened from
storylines.title: An Absurd Grand Dream

storylines.description: My dragon throne, my realm, my beauties — how could a mere Crown Prince covet them!
storylines.title: Emperor You of Xuan

storylines.description: Ruolan, Sheng'er has grown up now…
storylines.title: Emperor Zong of Xuan

storylines.description: You have truly made old Zhu suffer
storylines.title: The Dimmed Imperial Star

storylines.description: Fortunately Zhu Yuanzhi rushed to rescue the sovereign and should be made Grand General!
storylines.title: Grand General Zhu

storylines.description: Reform requires leadership; Xie Xuan has languished so many years — now is the time to use him
storylines.title: Visiting the Marquis of Yongning

storylines.description: Now is the time to have Xie Xuan devote himself and serve the cause of Xuan
storylines.title: Words of Persuasion

storylines.description: Unexpectedly, Chen Wan'er brought her son to pay respects to Ruolan
storylines.title: Paying Respects to Ruolan

storylines.description: Sikong Xu wishes to make your right-hand man, the powerful general Zhu Yuanzhi, his mentor
storylines.title: Requesting an Imperial Tutor

storylines.description: Zhu Yuanzhi grows more overbearing; the military ministry has repeatedly impeached him as disobedient despite his great achievements
storylines.title: The Overbearing General

storylines.description: According to Fan Zhong, rumors say Zhu Yuanzhi has the makings of an emperor
storylines.title: Rumors among the People

storylines.description: Regarding how to handle Zhu Yuanzhi, Xie Jian'an asks your stance
storylines.title: Employment of Personnel

storylines.description: The Eastern Yan requests to marry the Xuan princess as a condition for alliance
storylines.title: Marriage Alliance

storylines.description: Xie Xuan's reforms end in failure
storylines.title: Failed Reforms

storylines.description: Between you and Xie Xuan there seems an invisible wall; apart from "let it be," words are powerless
storylines.title: Estrangement

storylines.description: Facing Xie Xuan's perfunctory attitude, you seem to have no choice but to give up
storylines.title: Perfunctory Response

storylines.description: Reform in Qingzhou faces many difficulties; Xie Jian'an asks you to recall Xie Xuan
storylines.title: Thwarted Reforms

storylines.description: Recall Xie Xuan — we cannot let him fall into danger again
storylines.title: Ceasing Action

storylines.description: Grant Xie Xuan the Shangfang sword; if a policy is changed, change it thoroughly
storylines.title: Pursuing Reform to the End

storylines.description: The gentry's troops are near the capital — will Zhu Yuanzhi truly come to their aid?
storylines.title: Suspicion

storylines.description: The gentry's forces are near the capital, Zu Yue is held up by Wu Pu, and the court is alarmed — what to do?
storylines.title: Restless Fear

storylines.description: Your past leniency in sparing Sikong Zheng has now produced this great disaster
storylines.title: The Deposed Emperor of Xuan

storylines.description: The gentry alliance has reached the capital; faced with their demands you must decide
storylines.title: Choices and Sacrifices

storylines.description: What if troops are at the capital? If there must be war, then let there be war — I will not compromise with the gentry
storylines.title: The Ill-Fated Emperor of Xuan

storylines.description: Execute Xie Xuan to divide the gentry; your path must not end here — you must lead Da Xuan onward
storylines.title: Weighing Priorities

storylines.description: Shi Lang has prepared for years and at last musters his great host southward
storylines.title: The Iron Hooves March Southward

storylines.description: Reform failed and state strength was harmed — facing Shi Lang's southern army, what will you do?
storylines.title: Striving to Respond

storylines.description: The wounds of failed reform have not healed; retreating to Tianhe is the safest course
storylines.title: Emperor Huai of Xuan

storylines.description: Even if reforms failed and the state is weak, you do not intend to hand the northern passes to others
storylines.title: Emperor Ai of Xuan

storylines.description: Toil and governance are for the present era; Xuan and Wu Pu still have one last battle!
storylines.title: There Is Still a Battle to Fight

storylines.description: With the realm at peace, we should not start new wars; to spare the people suffering, retreating to Tianhe is the wisest
storylines.title: Emperor Kang of Xuan

storylines.description: This barrier joining Heaven and Earth, built on blood, can secure peace for ten thousand generations
storylines.title: Emperor Ming of Xuan

storylines.description: Years of accumulation — all for the day we no longer endure others' bullying
storylines.title: March North with the Army

storylines.description: Urgency — Shi Lang breaches the central camp
storylines.title: King Against King

storylines.description: Shi Lang shoots and kills the Xuan Emperor in desperation, reversing the battle
storylines.title: The Tides of War Have Shifted Once More

storylines.description: Wu Pu is trapped and the arrow is on the string; yet a dispatch arrives from the rear
storylines.title: Chaos in the Rear

storylines.description: Chen Wan'er executes a gentry minister to quell the unrest
storylines.title: The Cry of the Luan and Phoenix

storylines.description: Your time is nearly up; you must arrange your affairs before the end
storylines.title: Ruler and Subject, Each in Their Place

storylines.description: You possess countless beauties, but as life wanes you only want one by your side
storylines.title: A Ladle of Weak Water

storylines.description: The opportunity for battle can be sought again, but the state must not be lost — withdraw quickly to pacify the realm
storylines.title: Emperor Zhuang of Xuan

storylines.description: To whom should this Xuan realm be entrusted? You already have your choice
storylines.title: The Decree of Abdication

storylines.description: If you hand Xuan to the eldest, will the second truly willingly assist?
storylines.title: Father and Son

storylines.description: You ask your ministers whom they think should succeed you
storylines.title: Who Shall Bear the Great Responsibility

storylines.description: Guard the land and open new frontiers — what is one life to that?
storylines.title: The Nine Provinces United as One

storylines.description: Let Sheng'er rule while Xu'er assists; our Sikong household must no longer be stained by kin's blood
storylines.title: Emperor Jing of Xuan

storylines.description: In an imperial house there is no room for family sentiment. To ensure Sikong Sheng's smooth succession, you decide to poison your younger son
storylines.title: Emperor Cheng of Xuan

storylines.description: The state rises by martial strength; with Xu'er and General Zhu supporting each other, Da Xuan can be at peace
storylines.title: Emperor Wen of Xuan

storylines.description: Not knowing how it began, yet falling in deep
storylines.title: A Pair of Lovebirds

storylines.description: A benevolent ruler and good ministers entrust the realm to Sheng'er and General Zu Yue; there will be no worries
storylines.title: Emperor Guangwu of Xuan

storylines.description: Balance is the art of power — but sometimes it goes too far
storylines.title: Emperor Zhao of Xuan

storylines.description: Grudges and favors entwined
storylines.title: Intertwined Branches

storylines.description: Together forever, together longing
storylines.title: A Pair of Flying Swallows
